Description: Burnt pottery figurine of a man with his left arm resting on his shoulder, feet slightly splayed, and a supporting tail behind, mainly lost: the features of the face are crudely modelled to indicate nose, eyes, mouth and ears. The figure is roughly formed by pinching the mud into shape before firing.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie (probably)
Condition: Fragile surface, broken left arm and tail
